qas.question: What happened to Bishop leaders who did not agree with the doctrine?
When did Athanasius return to his position as Patriarch?

answers.text: after the death of Emperor Constantius

qas.question: Who joined him when he formed a council to encourage unity among Christians?
What happened to Bishop leaders who agreed with the doctrine?

plausible_answers.text: after the death of Emperor Constantius

qas.question: When did Athanasius return to his position as pope?
Who left him when he formed a council to encourage unity among Christians?

context: In 361, <a2_0><b6_0>after the <b4_0>death of Emperor Constantius<b6_0/><b4_0/><a2_0/>, shortly followed by the <a0_0>murder<a0_0/> of the very unpopular Bishop George, Athanasius returned to his patriarchate. The following year he convened a council at Alexandria, and presided over it with <a3_0><b7_0>Eusebius of Vercelli<b7_0/><a3_0/>. Athanasius appealed for unity among all those who had faith in Christianity, even if they differed on matters of terminology. This prepared the groundwork for his definition of the orthodox doctrine of the Trinity. However, the council also was directed against those who denied the divinity of the Holy Spirit, the human soul of Christ, and Christ's divinity. Mild measures were agreed on for those heretic bishops who repented, but <a1_0><b5_0>severe penance<b5_0/><a1_0/> was decreed for the chief leaders of the major heresies.
